findings.title: MT - Mints Tokens
findings.description: The `forestAddress` address has the authority to mint tokens. The `forestAddress` address may take advantage of it by calling the mint function. As a result, the contract tokens will be highly inflated.

findings.title: L18 - Multiple Pragma Directives
findings.description: If the contract includes multiple conflicting pragma directives, it may produce unexpected errors.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure they cannot be changed after being set, which decreases gas consumption of the corresponding transaction.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity naming conventions, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on variables configured by user-supplied input without proper checks for zero values, leading to potential problems and unexpected behavior.

findings.title: L19 - Stable Compiler Version
findings.description: The `^` symbol indicates that any version of Solidity that is compatible with the specified version can be used to compile the contract. The version lock is a mechanism that allows the author to specify a minimum version of the Solidity compiler that must be used to compile the contract code.

findings.title: BT - Burns Tokens
findings.description: The `apeAddress`, `caveAddress`, and `upgradeAddress` have the authority to burn tokens from a specific address. They may take advantage of it by calling the burn function, resulting in the targeted contract address losing the corresponding tokens.

findings.title: OTUT - Transfers User's Tokens
findings.description: The `caveAddress` address has the authority to transfer the balance of a user’s contract to the `caveAddress` address.
